reviewText: A beautiful film and perhaps one of the best I've seen from the limited lexicon of the WW1 genre. If you expect gritty trench warfare drama, look elsewhere because the tragedy of war plays out here between two unlikely lovers in a stark Norman farmhouse. Rachel Ward as director eclipses her career as actress. Brava! I will certainly be watching this film again.
This is a quiet little gem. You will not be disappointed giving yourself an hour or so to explore this world. It's got some hard truths but a tender and enduring message. enjoy
Excellent sound and picture quality  fantastic film excellent sound and picture quality fantastic film But also very sad film
Great movie. It's about the humanity of people in the worst of circumstances and what we can be

This movie is not a typical WWI war movie, it is about a romance set during the last days of the war. My friend and I were not expecting this. But we  both thought it was well done. I have watched it several times since and enjoyed each time. On short, it is the story of a French woman and an Australian deserter whom she hides . What more watch the movie.
